data.title: FR: local file support for html
data.body:
I don't think there is a technical reason preventing this -- it should be able to live parallel to internal files in localstorage, using different path prefixes?

Version: 1.9.3
#### Please select the affected platforms
- [ ] Android
- [ ] iOS (robovm)
- [ ] iOS (MOE)
- [X] HTML/GWT
- [ ] Windows
- [ ] Linux
- [ ] MacOS

data.title: It's unclear how interpolations act like
data.body:
[This](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/wiki/Interpolation) article have good explanations for interpolations, but unfortunatelly, it's unclear how do these interpolations actually look like. That's important, if you want to have control over your variables.

So I rendered them using google charts: [interpolation.zip](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/files/301468/interpolation.zip)

They looks like these:
![bounce](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1666014/15839958/6b3027fc-2c4f-11e6-8ffe-2f6b81fdbf78.png) ![swingin](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1666014/15839961/6b323920-2c4f-11e6-931e-aec1a2a21681.png) ![elastic](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1666014/15840094/34e1f594-2c50-11e6-9b14-d406687c5a1c.png)

Would be great if you add them to the article. Thank you.

data.title: Ignored second call of ColorAction in SequenceAction
Android OnScreenKeyboard distorted when using immersive mode
data.body:
When enabling immersive mode the keyboard is streched. Its width is larger then the screen. Also it's height shrinks. Happens with the google keyboard, but also with all the others I've tested.
I would provide a screenshot, but its actually correct on all the screenshots I've made. 
(Very strange bug)

Please note, that the keyboard is only drawn wrong. Touch input is actually where it should be. 

I have done all my tests to fix this on a Nexus 7 (2012) with kitKat (android-19) but the same issue was reported by all my test-Users (~10 different devices)

Example here: 
https://github.com/hasuo/OSKBug-Example/
I've tested a lot of things to fix this, but no change. 

I've used libgdx 1.9.3, details are in the graddle files. No exceptions were logged.

I have only tested Android. 

As a work around I will try to switch immersive mode on/off whenever the keyboard is shown/not shown, but I would be very grateful for any pointers how to prevent this bug from happening.

data.title: Audio doesn't work [LWJGL3]
data.body:
#### Issue details

Audio doesn't work in the LWJGL3 backend.
This has been caused by #4104 .
First reported [here](http://www.badlogicgames.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=11&t=22754).
#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies

1.9.4-SNAPSHOT LWJGL3
#### Stacktrace

``` java
Lwjgl3Application: Couldn't initialize audio, disabling audio
java.lang.IllegalStateException: No ALCapabilities instance set for the current thread or process. Possible solutions:
   a) Call AL.createCapabilities() after making a context current.
   b) Call AL.setCurrentProcess() or AL.setCurrentThread() if an ALCapabilities instance already exists.
   at org.lwjgl.openal.AL.getCapabilities(AL.java:135)
   at org.lwjgl.openal.AL10.nalGenSources(AL10.java:669)
   at org.lwjgl.openal.AL10.alGenSources(AL10.java:687)
   at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.lwjgl3.audio.OpenALAudio.<init>(OpenALAudio.java:108)
   at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.lwjgl3.Lwjgl3Application.<init>(Lwjgl3Application.java:82)   
```
#### Please select the affected platforms
- [ ] Android
- [ ] iOS (robovm)
- [ ] iOS (MOE)
- [ ] HTML/GWT
- [x] Windows
- [x] Linux
- [x] MacOS

data.title: GlyphLayout ignores BitmapFontData.lineHeight when drawing multiline text
data.body:
#### Issue details

When trying to render multilined GlyphLayout, I had noticed that lines are spaced too far apart. When trying to adjust that by setting BitmapFontData.lineHeight (as it is used in calculating GlyphLayout.height, i had assumed that as a way of adjustment), I noticed that there is no change to how the font is rendered, even if i set BitmapFontData.lineHeight to zero.
#### Reproduction steps

Create a GlyphLayout with multilined text, then change BitmapFontData.lineHeight of its font to zero, with no effect.
#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies

LibGDX 1.9.3
#### Stacktrace

N/A
#### Affected platforms

Tested on windows, presumed to be a problem on all platforms.
#### Note

I am using Freetype to generate fonts. 
A workaround is to change FreeTypeFontParameter.spaceY to negative to fix the line spacing

data.title: Softkeyboard doesn't show up on GWT when using from a phone.
data.body:
#### Issue details

`Gdx.input.setOnscreenKeyboardVisible(true);` doesn't work on GWT when using from a phone.
#### Reproduction steps/code

Will add repro later.
#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies

1.9.3 or latest
#### Please select the affected platforms
- [x] HTML/GWT
- [x] Mobile
#### Possible Fix

It should be possible to add a fake `<input type="text>` and focus it.
This should bring up the keyboard on most platforms.

First reported here http://www.badlogicgames.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=12&t=18011

data.title: GLversion instance not available at ApplicationListener::create time on iosrobovm backend
data.body:
This is due to the `GLVersion` instance being created later on, after `app.listener.create();` is called in [IOSGraphics.java](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/master/backends/gdx-backend-robovm/src/com/badlogic/gdx/backends/iosrobovm/IOSGraphics.java#L310).

I'm not sure if the `GLVersion` instance should or shouldn't be available at `create()` time, but it looks like to be the right place to log one-off GL information at startup time: the Android and desktop backends behave the same and i can safely use the instance there.
#### Please select the affected platforms
- [ ] Android
- [X] iOS (robovm)
- [ ] iOS (MOE)
- [ ] HTML/GWT
- [ ] Windows
- [ ] Linux
- [ ] MacOS

data.title: Strange behavior with touchDragged
Request gdx-jnigen
Lwjgl3Application desktop window disappears on resize
data.body:
I understand that Lwjgl3 is a new and unstable back-end, but If this is an actual, non-local issue, reporting this might be helpful.
#### Issue details

Using the Lwjgl3 backend on OS X El Capitain, the resulting window cannot be resized. When attempt to resize it is made, the window either disappears or quickly shrinks to what I assume is a 1x1 rectangle. The game continues to run, but no interaction seems to be possible.
#### Reproduction steps/code

The steps I took:
1. Create new LibGDX application from the latest setup app
2. Change backend to lwjgl3 from lwjgl
3. Update the desktop launcher class accordingly
4. Run the application and attempt to resize the window
#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies

The man build.gradle file lists the following versions:

```
gdxVersion = '1.9.3'
roboVMVersion = '2.1.0'
box2DLightsVersion = '1.4'
ashleyVersion = '1.7.0'
aiVersion = '1.8.0'
```
#### Stacktrace

N/A
#### Please select the affected platforms
- [ ] Android
- [ ] iOS
- [ ] HTML/GWT
- [ ] Windows
- [ ] Linux
- [x] MacOS
#### Video

[Issue Video](http://puu.sh/p9uB5/bc710cd42d.mp4)

data.title: Current display mode HZ/freq is not posible to read
data.body:
#### Issue details

The display mode that reports LWJGL2 backend is only the initial mode, which normally results in the highest display frequency even when display mode is changed with lower frequency.

Possible solution was provided in #3903 but caused #3997, probably due to attempting to get display mode in window mode (not confirmed) probably due to window not having own hz/bpp parameters as its not a "monitor display mode" per se

Maybe an alternate solution would be to provide a dedicated getHZ/getBPP or similar mechanism to workaround the limitation.
#### Reproduction steps/code
- Set fullscreen display mode with lower display hz than maximum supported by monitor
- Read the current display mode
#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies
- 1.9.2
- 1.9.3
#### Please select the affected platforms
- [?] Android
- [?] iOS
- [?] HTML/GWT
- [X] Windows
- [X] Linux
- [?] MacOS

data.title: Gdx.input.getY() is flipped
[WIP] Make scene2d groups generic
data.body:
I wanted to subclass a `Group` that could only contain a certain kind of `Actor`. This would result in an unnecessary amount of casting from an Actor to a subclass. 

I thought about making my own implementation of group but that stops quite a few of the group parts of the API from working (e.g. I can no longer set `actor.parent`).

The logical conclusion of this is to make Groups generic.

Any implementation I can think of will lead to breaking BC in some way. At first I tried creating a `class GenericGroup<T extends Actor>` and then re-implemented Group to simply be:

``` java
public class Group extends GenericGroup<Actor> { }
```

But that broke things in spectacular ways.

Changing `Group` to `Group<T extends Actor>` is far more stable and if things do break it's a little more obvious, so that's what this PR contains.

I'm still not sure that this is the best way to move forward or even if something like this is required. I wanted to see what other people thought about this.
## Reverse for Actors

The complement to this is to make an `ActorContainer` interface. The generic `Group` would implement this and then all types of Group can be replaced with this. This would allow for people to create the lighter implementations of groups and successfully set actor's parents.

This may be overkill, though.

data.title: Distance Field Font renders certain characters with improper padding
Updated gdx-kiwi and gdx-lml extensions versions.
Update LWJGL3 to snapshot version #87
data.body:
I updated LWJGL3 to snapshot version #87, so we don't have to fix so much, when it's officially released.
I also updated it, so we can fix https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/issues/3886 since GLFW added controller connection and disconnection events.

data.title: It is no longer possible to use allowCompletion for continuous particle effects
Updated VisUI version
Music.setOnCompletionListener along with looping
data.body:
I am developing a game with LibGDX for desktop, currently testing on Windows 10.

I noticed that a musics completion listener won't be executed if looping is set to true.
This behaviour have some drawbacks. 

For example, most game music consist of an intro, a starting point for looping and obviously an end. When a music ends, we set the position to the looping point in the completion listener and starts playing it again. 
This is nice because we only  want to hear the intro the first time.

Since the music is in a stopped state in the listener, we will get a short pause each time the music loops, making it sound laggy. Some songs are from the starting point to the end just 30 seconds, giving us a "pause" ever half minute.

In TinySound for example, the completion listener is executed even if looping is set to true. So we simply set the position there and the results are smooth and nice.

Can we get something similar in LibGDX?

data.title: Quaterion.getAngleAround returns wrong angle at certain angles
data.body:
#### Issue details

Quaterion.getAngleAround returns wrong angle at certain angles (above 239 in this case)
Seems to be the same issue as #2547 but it was incorrectly closed. The issue is not fixed.
#### Reproduction steps/code

```
    for(int i=0; i<360; i++) {
        float angle = new Matrix4().rotate(Vector3.Y, i).getRotation(new Quaternion(), true).getAngleAround(Vector3.Y);
        System.out.printf("%.2f -> %.2f \n", (float) i, angle);
    }
```

You can clearly see that after 239, angles aren't correct.

Quaternion.getYaw seems to return correct values, so it seems that generated quaternion is set correctly, the problem is with Quaternion.getAngleAroundRad method
#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies

libgdx-nightly-20160516

data.title: OpenGL 2.0 or higher with the FBO extension is required
data.body:
Windows 10(64-bit)

```
Exception in thread "LWJGL Application" com.badlogic.gdx.utils.GdxRuntimeException: OpenGL 2.0 or higher with the FBO extension is required. OpenGL version: 1.1.0
Type: OpenGL
Version: 1:1:0
Vendor: Microsoft Corporation
Renderer: GDI Generic
    at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.lwjgl.LwjglGraphics.initiateGLInstances(LwjglGraphics.java:346)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.lwjgl.LwjglGraphics.initiateGL(LwjglGraphics.java:225)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.lwjgl.LwjglGraphics.setupDisplay(LwjglGraphics.java:216)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.lwjgl.LwjglApplication.mainLoop(LwjglApplication.java:142)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.lwjgl.LwjglApplication$1.run(LwjglApplication.java:124)
```

OpenGL version 4.0
